clinical_study.brief_title: An Algorithm for Predicting Blood Loss and Transfusion Risk in Fast Track Total Hip Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: An Algorithm for Predicting Blood Loss and Transfusion Risk in Fast Track Total Hip Arthroplasty

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Ospedaliera Bolognini di Seriate Bergamo

clinical_study.source: Azienda Ospedaliera Bolognini di Seriate Bergamo

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of these study is to create an algorithm, using data from patients that undergoing total hip arthroplasty, to predict blood loss after surgery and permit a safe domestic discharge.

detailed_description.textblock: Two different cohorts of patients undergoing total hip arthroplasty will be analyzed to obtain data about hemoglobin trends. The first group will be used to obtain the algorithm, the second one to validate results of the first group, determining sensitivity and specificity.

primary_outcome.measure: Create an algorithm to predict blood loss after total hip arthroplasty
primary_outcome.description: Data from the fist cohort of patients have been collected and analyzed to obtain an algorithm describing the trends of hemoglobin values after total hip arthroplasty. These algorithm was after applied to patients of a second cohort of consecutive patients undergoing total hip arthroplasty to determine specificity and sensitivity.

arm_group.description: Create an algorithm to predict blood loss using patients data
The algorithm was applied to analyze sensitivity and specificity

intervention.intervention_name: Total hip arthroplasty, blood loss analysis
intervention.description: Data analysis about blood loss in total hip replacement

study_pop.textblock: 124 patients, in two different cohorts, undergoing total hip arthroplasty.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with hip arthritis
Exclusion Criteria:
- ASA 4 - 5
- Active treatment with warfarin
- Coagulation disorders

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Azienda Ospedaliera Bolognini di Seriate Bergamo
